page.title: 01General Overview
page.content: This block is a tranquil, sparsely populated rural area of the East Sussex Weald. Cattle, sheep and horses graze on pastureland and some corn crops grow in fields of fertile, light clay soil. The widespread breeding of poultry is indicated by the many large chicken sheds. Farming land is separated from the country lanes by hedges and wide grass verges in which wild flowers grow. Broad-leafed woodland punctuates the landscape. The community lacks main drainage and gas. There are no schools and the infrequent buses serve only the main roads. The most significant non-agricultural work is provided by a group of companies on a farm at Easons Green. The only intrusions on this scenic beauty are daily low flying jet training aircraft and pylons carrying national grid cables overhead.
